main event: On July 22, 1955, a ground-visual observation of a long, wingless, silver object with no sound was reported in Santa Maria, California. The observation lasted for 15 seconds.
interesting points: The object was described as long, wingless, and silver, without producing any sound.
The sighting occurred during the daytime.
There were no photographs taken of the observed object.
A memo routing slip indicated the possibility of the object being a balloon, as similar sightings were reported in other locations as well.
A Navy blimp was considered as a possible explanation for the observed object.
